intro: Quercus laceyi, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its white to pale gray bark and lobed leaves. The tree produces acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates. Quercus laceyi is valued for its ecological role and is often found in oak woodlands and forest edges.
